title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. II, pt. 54 - Duties Of Pilotage
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. II, pt. 54 - Duties Of Pilotage

State Regulations
§ 54.1 - In the Port of New York: Ending of pilot's services; assisting in docking or undocking; mooring or leaving mooring berth; and leaving a vessel underway
§ 54.2 - Hudson River pilots and Long Island Sound-Block Island Sound pilots: Ending of pilot's services; mooring or leaving a mooring berth (referred to as "docking" and "undocking" in Section 96, Part 3 of the Navigation Law); and leaving a vessel underway
§ 54.3 - Transporting vessels within the Port of New York
§ 54.4 - Records to be kept by pilots
§ 54.5 - Illness of or injury to pilot; return to duty
§ 54.6 - Absence from duty; notification to the board; refresher passages
§ 54.7 - American vessels under enrollment, American vessels under register and foreign vessels: license requirements
§ 54.8 - Renumbered
§ 54.9 - Renumbered
§ 54.10 to 54.11 - Repealed

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. II, pt. 54

Statutory authority: Navigation Law, §95

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
